revised_title: Measurement of Alpha Particle Emission Rate from Radium
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the rate of alpha particle emission from radium using a new type of counter developed by Greinacher. They found that the number of alpha particles emitted per second per gram of radium is 8,000, which can be directly compared with previous measurements. This study demonstrates the potential of the valve counter in the investigation of artificial element disintegration and other radioactive work.
